RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: 1993: Graduation from the University of Genoa. Thesis on L'obbligatoriet dell'azione penale e l'indipendenza del Pubblico Ministero" (Supervisor: Professor Paolo Ferrua). 1994/1997: Ph. D. student in "Analytic Philosophy and General Theory of Law", three-years fellowship offered by the University of Milan. 1998: Fellowship from the University of Genoa. 1999: Post-doc Fellowship at the University of Cagliari (Supervisor Prof. Anna Pintore). June-August: Research period at the Aberdeen University (Scozia-U.K.). 2000: November: Attorney at Law (Bar Exam from the Court of Appeal of Genoa). November: Research fellowship from the University of Genoa (Title of the research "Legal sources, norms and interpretation" Supervisor Professor Riccardo Guastini). 2001: Member of the scientific and editorial board of Diritto e questioni pubbliche (on-line journal).Member of the scientific program for "Junior Researchers", granted by European Commision (PhD EuroConferences in Legal Philosophy: Current Challenges to the European Legal Thought). 2003: Member of the editorial board of Ragion pratica (Italian paper journal). Teaching training: "State, Constitution, Democracy", special part of the course "Theories of Justice" (Prof. Mariangela Ripoli) 2004: Research fellowship from University of Brescia (Title of the research: Aspects of legal globalization and interpretative problems in law. Supervisor Prof. Tecla Mazzarese). 13 February: Paper Liberalism and the Freedom from Poverty as a Fundamental Right presented at the "ESRC Seminar Series: Towards a Global Society: An Exploration of Agents, Constraints, Conflicts, Challenges and Opportunities". The Globalisation and Social Exclusion Unit, Department of Sociology, Social Policy and Social Work Studies, Liverpool University. 2005: 1 March: Researcher at the University of Brescia, Faculty of Law, Department of Legal Sciences; start teaching "Teories of Justice" A.A. 2005-2006 to which was added the following year "Legal Informatics" and Philosophy of law . The first two the first two taught to date (2014). Since 2009 she is director (with Rafael Escudero Alday) of the book series Post-positivismo y Derecho published by Palestra (Per). Since 2010 she is engaged in the research group La soggettivit politica delle donne (political subjectivity of women), and in the work of the Sui Generi(s) Laboratory constituted at University of Genoa; she is in the editorial board of the international review About Gender (published by Genoa University). Lectures on World Poverty, Global Justice and Gender, Master in Global Rule of Law and Constitutional Democracy, Genoa University.
